_prev_prog_3.Description:
The Risk Management Program information shall include information pertaining to the hazards of the highly hazardous chemical used or produced by the process, information pertaining to the technology of the process, and information pertaining to the equipment of the process.

The employer shall document that equipment complies with recognized and generally accepted good engineering practices. RCPC has documentation for equipment that comply with this requirement. Older equipment and lines are covered under the standard operating procedures and parts' manuals. For existing equipment designed and constructed in accordance with codes, standards, or practices that are no loner in gerneal use, RCPC shall determine and document that the equipment is designed, maintained, inspected, tested, and operating in a safe manner.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ms provide information on preventing accidents through knowledge of hazards and safe work practices.

ES.3    Facility Identification

Ronson Corporation has been operating at the 3 Ronson Road facility for approximately 50 years.  Two buildings are located on-site.  One is a one-story brick building which houses offices, the processing areas, shipping/receiving and raw material and finished product storage functions.  The second building is a one-story metal warehouse used for storage of dry goods and empty cardboard containers.

The Ronson (processing area) facility is comprised of the following:
A?    Multi-Lube product line
A?    Kleenol product line
A?    Ronsonol product line
A?    Quality Control
A?    Quality Assurance

Ronson Corporation operations include the filling and blending of specific materials into final products.  These final products are then dispensed into containers through fill lines, with the containerized materials being sold as consumer commodities. 

Multi-Lube
Multi-Lube filling operations are conducted in the Fill Room.  Multi-Lube is a mixture of a Mineral spirits (5,000 gallon tank), fragrance (5 gallon pail), Oils and Alox (55 gallon drum).   Mineral spirits are fed through a feed tube into a 2,000 gallon mix tank and mixed with Oils/Alox, which are pneumatically fed.  Containment and control systems have been installed to minimize overflow and recover multi-lube and re-circulate back to the mix tank for re-use.

Kleenol
Kleenol filling operations are conducted in the Fill Room.  Kleenol is a mixture of a Mineral spirits (5,000 gallon tank), fragrance (5 gallon pail), Isopropyl Alcohol (55 gallon drum), Glycol Ether (55 gallon drum), Surfactants (55 gallon drum) and water.   Mineral spirits are manually fed into mix tank (55 gallon plastic drum) and mixed with the other ingredients, which are manually fed.

Ronsonol
